title: TmsT to create Commander Keen Movie 2005
content:
I said there would be a full Commander Keen feature movie by 2004 and there wasn't... So I guess I'll hafta make one myself.

In this forum topic, I don't really want expressions of interest or encouragement just yet, I want samples of people's voice acting.

The characters are:

Billy/Keen
Mortimer
Teacher
School kids
Mortimer's nerdy sidekicks
Bloogs

Some notes on voices:

Billy is a 10 year old boy, and as we know, he is from Milwaukee, USA. I don't know what a Milwaukee accent sounds like as opposed to a "generic" American accent (if there is such a thing), but Milkaukee is in the state of Wisonsin, kind of near Canada.

Mortimer is Billy's age. I reckon should have a "Southern Drawl". Think Dr Loveless from the Wild Wild West movie. Also it'd be cool if his voice could sound like the whiny nerdy voice of Mandark from Dexter's Lab.
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mortlol.gif[/img]

Teacher doesn't have a name or a gender yet. His/her catchphrase is "Oh, why do I even bother anymore."

The Bloogs are stupid. They speak in dumb voices. This could mean stupid like the typical "henchman" deep voice, or it could be the higher, hyperactively stupid voice like GIR from Invader Zim, or Pinky from Pinky & The Brain. There are a number of different Bloogs in this movie, so there can be a range of voices (and accents).

I want to involve everyone in the Keen community in this... but only those have access to a microphone will be able to help, unfortunately.

Once I've cast the voices for the main characters, it'll be up to you to get your parts recorded and sent my way and then begin the long wait as I animate it. It could take a few months, if not half a year, to get everything recorded and animated.

If you can't get your voice samples hosted online, email them to me at
frencheroticfilm@gmail.com
(10MB file size limit)

Know that by being cast you agree to leak NO details of the characters, script, or plot, on pain of something painful. It's all top secret, as is usually the deal with my movies.


Cheers

Andrew Kepple (Director/Producer)----------
The Chasm of Strife (deceased): www.ThisStrife.com/Sluggy/chasm.htm

title: Re: TmsT to create Commander Keen Movie 2005
content:

Types of voices that I can do...
*Sly
*Gay
*Goofy
*Nerdy
*Rough (Think Marge Simpson)

i can't think of anything else.-- Shame on you if you fool me once, shame on me if you fool me twice --

title: Re: Grr...
content:
Bloog#1: Xky.

I love your Mort impression, kinda like a badboy Colonel Sanders. I reckon that with a bit of messing around in CoolEdit I could make the voices sound younger. (In DNF, I had to use Cool edit to make Duke's and Proton's voices sound even more different than how I had voiced them.)
You will have to find a slightly better quality recording device if you're cast, though. If you know anyone with a camcorder, you could use the soundtrack from that instead of a mic. That's what I do.

If any of you auiditionees want to digitally affect your voice to make it sound more childlike, or more alien/robotic, please do so.

Also, Spot has a small cameo role in this movie. How do you think a Yorp vocalises? A yorp yelp? Would it be doglike? Seal-like?----------

title: Re: w00t!
content:
No, I'm sad to say that what rudimentary XAX material I had on file was all lost in the hard-drive tragedy I had a few months ago. I do still have a lot of sketches and vague plot outlines, but the synopsis that I wrote has gone forever.
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img]
Too bad. It was a good story. It might even be worth resurrecting someday.

But this is not XAX. This is THE Commander Keen Movie, made by Keen fans, as it should be.
[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]
I know that you're good with voices, Ilsoap. Consider yourself cast in at least one role.----------

title: well...
content:
A while back, when TMST was first starting this project, the big hang-up was that we couldn't find anybody to be the voice of Keen. A movie about Keen with no Keen voice actor (or actress) wasn't going to get very far.

However, in recent months, TMST has hinted that things might be picking up again. Having seen his flash movies on Newgrounds, and witnessed the fact that there's little girl voice acting in them, I'd wager TMST has found somebody's little sister to be a potential voice actress for Keen. (In many animated features, little boys are voiced by women. See Bart Simpson as a classic example.)

Just a guess... :-)

title: Re: well...
content:
Well actually, I tried out the idea of having Keen voiced by females, but it wasn't much better than with males of my age. HOWEVER...

See my new animated series "StrifeToons", in which I used my own voice and some simple pitch-adjustment in a sound editor to create a Commander Keen voice. It's exactly the same as the voice of Baseball Timmy at the end of Up Skit Creek 2.

Let me know if it's good enough, or if you can do better using this technique, or if my Milwaukean accent needs brushing up, or whatnot. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rollhead.gif[/img] ----------
www.StrifeStrips.com! Woot! We're back, baby!

title: Re: The Voice of Keen
content:
A little update on The Movie...

So this kid auditioned for one of the minor cameo roles in StrifeToons 2, today. Although he auditioned late, he has an unbroken male voice, an American accent, and some natural voice-acting abilitiez.

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] *worships the Slug* Thankyouthankyouthankyouthankyou!

I'm going to try him out for the role of Keen in Strifetoons 3 to see how he goes. As long as his voice doesn't break anytime soon, he might just have saved the Commander Keen Movie. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rollhead.gif[/img]

WE SHALL SEE. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-spotkeen.gif[/img] ----------

title: well...
content: Castrating him would mean his voice would never change and drop into the deeper register that a man's voice typically does. This was actually common practice in Italy in the early Baroque, as Opera was first coming into play... the Italians wrote huge expressive arias for castrati to sing--and the masses went wild for them.

content:

title: hehe
content: Hehe... well, in an era before birth control, making a man effectively unable to impregnate a woman is a surefire way of making him more receptive to sexual promiscuity... or some such.  :-P  Still, it's bizarre to think about by today's standards.  Wonder what they'll say about the various popular piercings we do today in another thousand years?

title: Re: hehe
content:
Hehe yeah, it'd be like...

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-korath.gif[/img] So... your "ear-ring", it's a little bulky for something that simply enhances hearing ability, yes?

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] It doesn't do that!

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-korath.gif[/img] Oh... perhaps it's some kind of rudimentary psychotelecommunications transceiver then?

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] Nup! It's just a ring, through my ear.

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-korath.gif[/img] So... It doesn't even protect you from solar radiation?

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] Haha! Why would it need to? It's just an ear ring. It's a ring through my ear. Hence, EAR... RING.

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-korath.gif[/img] So it doesn't d-

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] No, it doesn't. It just... it's just THERE. And you can see it.

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-korath.gif[/img] Yes... But why would I want to... see... it?

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] What else would you want to do with it?

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-korath.gif[/img] Well... Communicate directly with the minds of my fellow Korathians... move objects with no muscular exertion... Shield me from the harmful rays of outer space... Allow me to breathe in atmosphere-lacking environments... Making-

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] But can your ear-rings make you seem trendy yet rebellious in the eyes of your peers?

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-korath.gif[/img] Well-

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] Hmm?
